Key Match Events: Jose Quintana blanked Washington for 21 innings over three starts without allowing a run.
Brandon Nimmo hit a three-run homer in the fourth inning.
The Mets had their biggest inning since September 2020, scoring nine runs in the fourth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets are in good position and feel strong heading into the playoffs.
Manager Carlos Mendoza expressed trust in Jose Quintana's pitches and repertoire.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jose Quintana extended his scoreless streak to a career-high 22 2/3 innings.
Brandon Nimmo had three potential homers sail just foul of the right-field pole in his previous four home games.
The Mets have won 15 of their last 19 games.
The Mets are close to the finish of the season and are in the second spot for the NL wild card with a two-game lead over Atlanta.
